thread.title: Suffragette premiere prize draw: Terms and Conditions
thread.title_full: Suffragette premiere prize draw: Terms and Conditions - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Suffragette premiere prize draw: Terms and Conditions
text: Suffragette European Premiere – Prize Draw Terms and Conditions 1. This prize draw is open to residents of the UK Mainland aged 18 years or over, except employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and its group companies (“Promoter”), and Pathé UK (“Pathé”), their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. Entries must be submitted via telegraph.co.uk/suffragette and entry is restricted to one per person. Once submitted, entries cannot be amended in any way. 4. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. The winner will be drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date. The winner’s name and county can be obtained by sending a sae to “Suffragette” European Premiere Prize Draw Winner, SPARK, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month after the closing date of the prize draw. 5. All entries must be received by midnight on Thursday, October 1, 2015. 6. The winner will be contacted by the Promoter by 17:00 on Friday October 2, 2015. Should the Promoter be unable to contact the winner or should the winner be unable to accept the prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award the prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. 7. The prize will be posted to winner by Pathé UK using registered post. A signature will be required upon delivery. 8. The prize as described is available on the date of publication. Should the prize become unavailable, a substitute of equal value will be provided. 9. One winning entrant will win two tickets to the European Premiere of Suffragette , which takes place at Odeon, Leicester Square, London, on Wednesday, October 7, 2015. 10. Doors to the premiere open at 6pm and the audience must be seated by 6.45pm. A smart dress code applies. Suffragette is rated 12A and the winner’s guest must meet the age criteria according to the film’s certification. Where the winner’s guest is under 18 years of age, they must have prior parental or guardian permission. Pathé UK reserves the right to refuse admittance where, at its sole discretion, these conditions are not met. 11. The prize does not include travel to the event, accommodation, food and drink, personal expenditure or incidental costs. 12. The elements of the prize are subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 13. The winner may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of Pathé and the Promoter. 14. Entrants’ data will be used for the purpose of administration of this prize draw and in accordance with the permissions granted or withheld at the point of entry. 15. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prize impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter. Accordingly the Promoter may, at its absolute discretion, vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. 16. The Telegraph is responsible for the first part of the promotion, which is the publication and adjudication of the prize draw. Provision of the prize is the responsibility of Pathé. 17. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT. telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegraph
